action.action-desc: Mr. Sanford (for himself, Mr. Broun of Georgia, Mr. Mulvaney, Mr. Grayson, Mr. Bentivolio, Mr. Rice of South Carolina, Ms. Norton, Mr. Massie, Mr. Amash, Mr. Gowdy, Mr. Sensenbrenner, Mr. Duncan of South Carolina, and Mr. Wilson of South Carolina) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Select Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select), and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To require the Director of the National Security Agency and the Inspector General of the National Security Agency to be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, and for other purposes.

section.header: Director of the National Security Agency

subsection.text: The National Security Agency Act of 1959 (50 U.S.C. 3601 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating section 2 as section 3; and
by inserting before section 3 (as so redesignated) the following new section:

section.text: There is a Director of the National Security Agency, who shall be appointed by the President, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, who shall serve as the head of the National Security Agency.

subsection.text: An individual serving as Director of the National Security Agency on the date of the enactment of this Act may continue so serving until the President makes an appointment under section 2 of the National Security Agency Act of 1959, as amended by subsection (a) of this section.

section.header: Inspector General of the National Security Agency

subsection.text: The Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 8G(a)(2), by striking the National Security Agency,; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting the National Security Agency, after the Federal Emergency Management Agency,; and
in paragraph (2), by inserting the National Security Agency, after the National Aeronautics and Space Administration,.

subsection.text: An individual serving as Inspector General of the National Security Agency on the date of the enactment of this Act pursuant to an appointment made under section 8G of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.)—

paragraph.text: may continue so serving until the President makes an appointment under section 3(a) of such Act with respect to the National Security Agency consistent with the amendments made by subsection (a); and

shall, while serving under paragraph (1), remain subject to the provisions of section 8G of such Act that, immediately before the date of the enactment of this Act, applied with respect to the Inspector General of the National Security Agency and suffer no reduction in pay.
